而且墨索里尼对国际局势的判断极其准确。一战之前精准的判断出沙皇俄国最终会在此战中自爆，早年作为左翼报刊前进报主编和列宁的关系很好。



墨索里尼是一个的黑化的左翼人士，把一个曾经赔付埃塞俄比亚战争款项的搞笑殖民国家。升格成占领阿尔巴尼亚和埃塞俄比亚，利比亚的猴版帝国。



如果是墨索里尼执政今天的俄罗斯，俄罗斯必将崛起成为世界一极。而不是像今日一般搞笑。

# 网络民族主义者给中国形象塑造带来两难境地
> 以下内容由Google翻译转自英文。[英文原文](https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2022-04-06/china-s-online-nationalists-threaten-its-image-abroad)

**极端主义博客为更自由的社会提供了抵御压力的堡垒。但北京面临风险，因为 Twitter 翻译网站与外界分享尖酸刻薄。**

![https://assets.bwbx.io/images/users/iqjWHBFdfxIU/iFfhbKo6n8J4/v1/800x-1.jpg](https://assets.bwbx.io/images/users/iqjWHBFdfxIU/iFfhbKo6n8J4/v1/800x-1.jpg)

中国国家电视台上周报道称，美国利用乌克兰平民作为实验室老鼠进行生物实验。该[短片](https://weibo.com/2656274875/LmrRRANEe?refer_flag=1001030103_)已获得超过 650 万次观看，并在中国类似 Twitter 的新浪微博社交媒体网站上获得超过 83,000 次点赞。

它还引发了大量反美评论。“嘘——，谁能压制美国？” 问最喜欢的人，有 12,000 人点赞。其他人将所谓的实验与日本臭名昭著的[731 部队](https://unit731.org/)进行了比较，后者在二战期间对中国平民进行了生物研究。

像这样的反美评论在中国社交媒体上并不新鲜或不寻常。但语言障碍常常使外界无法看到它。现在，一个匿名的推特账号“[大翻译运动”正在通过翻译和推特一些中国互联网上最流行和挑衅性的民族主义评论，](https://twitter.com/TGTM_Official)[包括乌克兰实验室老鼠的虚假信息](https://twitter.com/TGTM_Official/status/1510749484900229120)，发出光芒。

在一个月的时间里，它已经积累了超过 100,000 名追随者——其中包括热衷于向世界展示负责任形象的中国当局。最近几周，他们对 Twitter 帐户正在反击这一努力表示不满。目前，这是一个他们没有答案的困境。

几十年来，中国的宣传官员发布了针对华语和外国受众不同的宣读材料、官方成绩单和新闻稿。差异可能是细微的，但反映更加尖锐和民族主义态度的版本总是被保留为中文版本。提升中国在国外的形象是一种自我审查。

社交媒体构成了更为传统的审查挑战。尽管中国积极屏蔽和过滤与国家政治路线相反的观点和新闻，但并非所有出现在中国社交媒体上的东西都受到制裁。相反，它是被容忍的，直到它不是。

而从中国对社交媒体的喜爱之初，强硬的排外情绪就盛行起来。翻译中文内容的网站偶尔会关注[这些帖子](https://www.whatsonweibo.com/from-voice-of-the-people-to-traitor-of-china-the-rise-and-fall-of-fang-fangs-wuhan-diary/) （近年来更是如此）。

但受众往往很狭窄，由海外华人和中国专家社区组成，从学生到政策制定者，从供应链专业人士到外国记者。这是一个有影响力的组织，但规模足够小，以至于政府通常没有兴趣与翻译他们所消费的中文内容的网站进行斗争。

这种不干涉的做法在 2 月中旬发生了变化，因为中国男性微博提供“照顾”漂亮的乌克兰女性难民的翻译开始在全球传播。[媒体](https://supchina.com/2022/02/24/some-chinese-men-express-their-horniness-for-potential-ukrainian-refugees-to-the-disgust-of-netizens/)一片[哗然](https://www.dw.com/en/ukraine-sexist-comments-on-chinese-social-media-trigger-backlash/a-61049647)，在乌克兰激起了对华人的强烈反对，最重要的是，在中国政府试图树立自己在乌克兰问题上的理性发言权之际，这让中国政府感到非常尴尬。中国官方新闻媒体[警告](https://twitter.com/ZixuWang_News/status/1497861816096944130?ref_src=twsrc^tfw|twcamp^tweetembed|twterm^1497861822132613120|twgr^|twcon^s2_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fsupchina.com%2F2022%2F02%2F24%2Fsome-chinese-men-express-their-horniness-for-potential-ukrainian-refugees-to-the-disgust-of-netizens%2F)公民“理性”讨论战争，并删除违规帖子和账户。

不久之后，大翻译运动出现在推特（它诞生于 Reddit）上，[呼吁采取行动](https://twitter.com/TGTM_Official/status/1500644688743006208)：翻译极受欢迎的极端中文内容。匿名帐户[告诉](https://www.businessinsider.com/great-translation-movement-twitter-account-blowing-up-russia-ukraine-2022-3)《商业内幕》，其目标是“为世界其他地区充当告密者”，揭露其所称的源自中国的“邪恶”。

这个“邪恶”的样子各不相同，但在其存在的一个月里，该帐户已经吸引了众多追随者，重点关注支持普京的内容（“[我爱他胜过我丈夫](https://twitter.com/TGTM_Official/status/1500726030801145856)” ——1,635 个赞）、入侵（“[我们不能让盎格鲁-撒克逊入侵者扼杀这个世界的未来](https://twitter.com/TGTM_Official/status/1500873044469825541)” ——3,864 票），以及关于美国制造 Covid-19 并建造乌克兰生物实验室的指控（“[这是反人类罪](https://twitter.com/TGTM_Official/status/1501072287163846660/photo/2)！！”——46,000 人点赞） .

大翻译运动在方法上既不精巧、不平衡，也不特别专业。（例如，它经常不提及它翻译的内容的来源。）更糟糕的是，它没有表明中国社会的两极分化程度。

撇开这些问题不谈，它比近期记忆中的任何翻译网站都更受中国当局的关注。在过去的三周里，它成为了[至少](https://www.thepaper.cn/newsDetail_forward_17394048)[四篇](https://baijiahao.baidu.com/s?id=1728717870954507907&wfr=spider&for=pc)为着名的官方媒体机构撰写的偏执和过热的批评[的目标。](https://baijiahao.baidu.com/s?id=1729166855452646498&wfr=spider&for=pc)



一位与军方有关联的评论家为极端民族主义的《环球时报》撰稿时特别担心海外华人如何接受社交媒体翻译，其中许多人与中国保持密切联系。他[指责](https://opinion.huanqiu.com/article/47DoZsHVpv6)大翻译运动对中国的政治制度和人民进行信息战，以“达到在中国掀起‘颜色革命’的根本目标”。

《环球时报》非常清楚，中国的民族主义博客是对抗更加自由的中国出现的在线堡垒。然而，担心全球对中国民族主义的广泛认可，尤其是其最极端的形式，可能对中国的形象和执行外交政策的能力产生影响，这并没有错。

理论上，最受欢迎的民族主义帖子可能会受到审查。然而，这样做将是对政府最忠实支持者的政治愚蠢打击。然而，通过拒绝审查最恶毒的反美和亲俄内容（即使他们屏蔽了同情乌克兰的材料），当局正在默许一个希望中国在结束战争中发挥建设性作用的国际社会。

目前，当局似乎满足于攻击 Twitter 帐户，或许希望它消失。但从长远来看，政府需要找到一种方法，将其在线民族主义者的丑陋本质与其渴望的低调和负责任的公众形象相提并论。

来源：[Bloomberg: Online Nationalists Pose a Dilemma for China’s Image-Making](https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2022-04-06/china-s-online-nationalists-threaten-its-image-abroad)

2.各大考研机构都在拼命引流，加了很多23考研的高校群，都在引流北大。



3.去年被加群人数劝退的想考软微的没考上的人在看到了22年软微报考人数这么低的情况下，估计会回冲北大了，去年被吓到，看到结果后今年不相信加群人数多=报考人数多了。但是今年是真的要炸了，但是大家还是会冲，所以必炸。

大家慎重报考，再加上北京地区压分严重，而且软微是专硕11408，现在一大堆学校，即使是11408，专硕也不能调学硕，调剂就不好调，看那些大佬考的很高不一定你能考这么高，知乎上失败经验贴也很多，很多都是也努力了很久的985211本，一定慎重考虑再选择。

comments.text:
11. **Lead The Way**
    When you find yourself in a situation where everyone looks at each other, it’s time for you to lead. You‘re a leader when you decide to become one. There’s no initiation or a title. Just a decision.
12. **Money Is Not The Most Important Thing**
    You have to train yourself not to care about money and focus on providing value instead. Also, don’t become too dependent on the stuff you own — otherwise, the stuff will own you.
13. **Be Nice**
    I don’t mean you should be a pushover. You can be someone that doesn’t take shit and be nice about it. Just don’t insult people, think you’re better than them, or act like an idiot.
14. **Learn Every Day**
    You’ve got to train your brain to stay alert. You don’t have to read a book a day to learn every day. Learn from your mistakes. Learn from the people around you — be open to what they can teach you.
15. **Rest Before You Are Tired
    **Even if you love your job, and every day seems like a holiday, you need to take time to rest. You’re a human and not an android, never forget that.
16. **Don’t Judge**
    Just because people make different choices than you, they are not stupid. Also, you don’t know everything about people, so don’t judge them — help them.
17. **Think About Others**
    Just be mindful, that’s all. We all have families, bills to pay, and our own issues. Don’t always make everything about yourself.
18. **Give Without Expecting Something In Return**
    Don’t keep score. You will become a bitter person if you do that. Give solely for the joy of giving. If you get something in return, great, if you don’t, great.
19. **There’s No End Game**
    We, as species, just *are*. Don’t try to figure it all out. Enjoy your journey.
20. **Enjoy Small Things**
    I like clichés because they are true. Especially this one. You know why? Everyone says they know it, but no one lives up to it. They just chase big things.
21. **Don’t Take Yourself So Seriously**
    Yeah, yeah, you’re an individual, and people have to take you seriously, I get it. But at the end of the day, we’re all a bunch of ants trying to chase the same things. Lighten up.
22. **Don’t Blame People**
    What’s the point? Do you want to punish them? You don’t do that to people. Also don’t blame yourself — you’re only human.
23. **Create Something**
    Not to leave a legacy, you won’t be here to see it anyway, but to be of use. [Make music, write a book, build a table, anything](http://digitalbusiness.school/). You’ll feel good about yourself, plus you give something back to people to use or enjoy.
24. **Never Look Back Too Long**
    Reflecting on the past is only good for one thing: Learning.
25. **Take Action**
    Don’t just sit there, do something. Without action, there is no outcome.

You might know a lot about life. But like Socrates, you and I know nothing at all. So we have to keep learning.

data.text:
# 25 Things About Life I Wish I Had Known 10 Years Ago

[![25 things about life socrates](25 Things About Life I Wish I Had Known 10 Years Ago.assets/25-things-about-life-socrates.png)](https://i0.wp.com/dariusforoux.com/wp-content/uploads/2016/02/25-things-about-life-socrates.png?fit=665%2C499&ssl=1)

Socrates, considered as one of the founders of Western philosophy, was once named the wisest man on earth by the Oracle of Delphi. When Socrates heard that the oracle had made such a comment, he believed that the statement was wrong.

> Socrates said: “ I know one thing: that I know nothing.”

How can the smartest man on earth know nothing? I heard this paradoxical wisdom for the first time from my school teacher when I was 14 or 15. It made such an impact on me that I used Socrates’s quote as my learning strategy.

“I know nothing” to me, means that you might be a wise person, but still, you know nothing. You can learn from everything and everyone.

One thing that I like better than learning from my mistakes is to learn from other people’s mistakes. Over the years, I’ve been blessed to have great mentors, teachers, family, friends, that taught me about life.

What you will find below is a list of the most important things I learned from other people and books. Some of the lessons took me a long time to learn—but if I had to learn these things all by myself, it would take me a lot longer.

We might learn things quickly, but we often forget things at the same rate—and sometimes we need to remind ourselves of the things we’ve learned.

Here are 25 of those reminders that others taught me.



1. **Struggle Is Good**
   Never say “I can’t take it anymore.” Say “Bring it on!”
2. **Don’t Complain
   
   **[Complaining is the biggest waste of time there is](https://dariusforoux.com/self-discipline/). Either do something about it, and if you can’t, shut up about it.
3. **Spend Time With People You Love**
   That’s your family and best friends. If you don’t have a family, create one. Most people in life are only visitors. Family is for life.
4. **Don’t Start A Relationship If You’re Not In Love**
   I’ve done this more than once. You kind of like someone and think: “We might as well give it a shot.” Not a good idea. You’re either in love, or you are not. Don’t fool yourself. It’s not fair to you and the other person.
5. **Exercise Daily**
   I didn’t get this until recently. A healthy body is where you have to start everything in life. If you can’t build a healthy and strong body, what CAN you build in life?
6. **Keep A Journal**
   No, keeping a journal is not for children. It helps you to become a better thinker and writer. “I don’t want to be a writer” you might think. Well, how many emails and texts do you send a day? Everybody is a writer.
7. **Be Grateful**
   Say ‘thank you’ to everyone and everything. “Thank you for this beautiful day.” “Thank you for your email.” “Thank you for being there for me.”
8. **Don’t Care About What People Think**
   We all die in the end, do you really think it matters what people think of you?
9. **Take More Risks**
   Don’t be such a wimp.
10. **Pick An Industry, Not A Job**
    If you want to become good at something, you need to spend years and years doing that. You can’t do that if you hop from industry to industry. Pick an industry you love and start at the bottom. You will find the perfect role for you eventually.

![](https://bafkreicl4sqjtrffgrr7qpwrta2rbqmjex4pgnubt5wcgtny454g5namua.ipfs.hub.textile.io/?filename=1649296617690.jpeg&filetype=image%2Fjpeg)
